text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Hehehe! I think I even surprised<n>myself! They said it's a
new Yayoi<n>Sho record!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
When I saw Taishin right behind me, I<n>felt this power
surging up inside of<n>me.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
She taught me that a rival can help<n>you draw out a strength
in yourself<n>you didn't even... know you h-had...<n>Waaaaah!

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: I know I lost, but... I ran one heck of a<n>race.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
I can't believe how unfair this is. I'm<n>so envious I didn't
get to race with<n>you two.

If they keep this up, these three are<n>headed straight for the
first race of the<n>Classics, the Satsuki Sho.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text:
I won't lose the next one. However<n>good a race I give, it's
meaningless if<n>I don't win.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
Hehe, I won't be missing the Satsuki<n>Sho either. Next time,
we're in it<n>together.

The first showdown is over,<n>and—having raced her trusted<n>
rival—Winning Ticket smiles bigger<n>than ever.

Now she'll push forward into the<n>Classics and her
once-in-a-lifetime<n>dream, the Japanese Derby.
